ancillaries.colour_text: A man makes his own fate, sometimes.
It's only theft if you are caught.
The sword must be one with the hand.
Armour does not weaken the spirit.
When the heart is pure, the arrow finds a way.
The wise man runs with caution when touching cloth.
Men, like horses, need a firm hand.
Cold hands make strangers of familiar tasks.
Rain, fog and water drive the devils from black powder
Drill is a battle without blood.
The smell is sulphurous, the results: astounding!
A stud is always useful.
Guns are useless in the hands of idiots.
Warriors without swords are useless in war.
Peasants cannot hide everything.
A garden soothes the soul.
There can be mercy in a dish of tea.
"Here is Benkei! None shall pass!"
"Fall upon the enemy with the flames of Enryakuji in your hearts!"
Technique and honour separate the warrior on the battlefield from the peasant in the rice field.
"Fight ME!"
"Fools are always trapped by loyalty."
"You ain't seen me, right?"
A man cannot walk two paths at once. A choice lies at the start of every journey.
Lust and loathing are two sides of the same coin.
"Ignore all earthly beauty. It fades."
"Tajima... cut through those [arrows]... with his whirling naginata, so that even the enemy looked on in admiration."
A man at your back forestalls many problems.
There is solace, even for the warrior.
Every boy needs his hero.
Men are the fiercest prey of all.
Truth flies on swift wings.
The mob is not an army.
Words can move a man's heart to sorrow, or anger.
placeholder text: iron abumi stirrups
There is honour in serving well.
The cleansing stroke brings its own peace.
Speed comes more readily to the rider with a comfortable seat.
Dull eye and drooping ear speak eloquently of the suffering within.
There are many paths to heaven.
Loyalty reflects well on the one who gives it.
An honest faith armours an honest soul.
"You're nicked, my old beauty!"
Without stores, an army soon becomes a hungry mob.
A samurai may need his weapon at any moment.
A horse's speed is only a good as the oats it is fed.
Knowledge is better than rumour.
The hidden knife is no less deadly for being expected.
The arrow is no less important than the bow.
Cruel as summer, glinting goads stab, draft oxen bellow, doom rumbles on.
The pure heart beats louder than any war drum.
Nothing in battle should be a surprise.
Wealth is a full rice bowl.
There is little wisdom in bringing pain to others, yet much in avoiding pain.
"Do not look for wisdom. It will find you."
Strong drink is a comfort to some, a tool for others.
"O! For a muse of fire…"
Secrets and lies travel in the same cart.
The blessings of heaven come in many forms.
Sometimes looking is not the same as seeing.
The edge is where the moment is decided.
Food nourishes the spirit as well as the body.
Careful husbandry always improves the breed.
"Ah! Those. Give me a day. I'll find some…"
The first cut is the deepest.
The strongest steel will not serve in a worthless cause.
"Do not throw your bow when the arrows are gone!"
"Brave wounds mend the quickest!"
A target stands; an enemy thinks.
To cripple a horse is to stop the warrior.
Trade is beneath a samurai; money is not.
A horseman is only as good as his horse.
A banner, floating on the breeze, is a noble sight.
"Unbalanced? Nonsense! Next you'll be saying I'm unbalanced!"
Nothing ventured over dinner, nothing gained.
Battle gives a man a powerful thirst.
Doubt gnaws at the even the smallest grain of faith.
The faith of the people is the strength of the people.
"There is no enemy: defeat your own fears!"
placeholder text: wooden practice spears
The burden of a lifetime bends a man's back.
Horse and bow can be in harmony.
"Do not cut at your enemy. Perfect the stroke!"
The sure-footed way is its own reward.
Even the simplest thing must be mastered.
Men must be lead in battle.
The calm heart does not beat like a drum.
No task is humble if it is done well.
Make every shot count.
It's only theft if you are caught.
The sword must be one with the hand.
When the heart is pure, the arrow finds a way.
There are ironclad arguments as to why the Royal Navy rules the waves.
Cold hands make strangers of familiar tasks.
Even a frigate is only as fast as her crew.
The bullet is substantial. The needle is within the workings.
"54 seconds: not bad. Not outstanding either! Again!"
"Neatly done, Lieutenant. Carry on."
"Proven in combat, by the Confederate States of America, sir, among others."
A stud is always useful.
Even a little ship well-handled can punch above its weight.
Warriors without swords are useless in war.
"Fire on the rise!"
"The men respect me for it."
Peasants cannot hide everything.
"A foul bottom? How dare you sir?!"
"A Frenchman, sir, builds a ship with a soul. Any Anglo-Saxon idiot can make an ironclad."
A garden soothes the soul.
"Is there an able-bodied seaman anywhere on this ship?!"
Only a fool looks after his sword yet neglects his horse.
When you've few guns, make sure you fire often.
Every boy needs his hero.
Precision engineered for maximum efficiency.
Science removes the guesswork from gunnery.
"100 yards short again!"
"Other side lads. 'The port is always left on the table', remember?"
There is honour in serving well.
"At the double, men!"
Dull eye and drooping ear speak eloquently of the suffering within.
Without stores, an army soon becomes a hungry mob.
Simple, sturdy and soldier-proof. Deadly, in the right hands, too.
A samurai may need his weapon at any moment.
Victory can be decided on the pages of a ledger.
"You ain't seen me, right?"
A horse's speed is only a good as the oats it is fed.
Knowledge is better than rumour.
The old ways are not always the best.
Tried, tested and out-dated.
"Oh, drat these spectacles! Was that a hit? Sergeant?"
The arrow is no less important than the bow.
"Phew! I'll catch you up, men."
"All equipment to be correctly stowed BEFORE firing."
"See what I mean? Too narrow across the withers."
Nothing in battle should be a surprise.
"Don't you know your starboard from your larboard?"
Accuracy comes at a price.
"Take that man's name!"
"O! For a muse of fire…"
Secrets and lies travel in the same cart.
"Steady. Steady. Fire!"
The edge is where the moment is decided.
"YOU try standing still whilst someone fires a gun over your head!"
A good reliable weapon. As you'd expect from Her Majesty's Government.
Food nourishes the spirit as well as the body.
"Ah! Those. Give me a day. I'll find some…"
A horseman is only as good as his horse.
A banner, floating on the breeze, is a noble sight.
"Unbalanced? Nonsense! Next you'll be saying I'm unbalanced!"
"Gun practice, Lieutenant? Not today, I have a headache."
...click!...
A good crew is as one with their ship.
War is the school of warriors.
Man and beast in perfect harmony.
The sure-footed way is its own reward.
Even the simplest thing must be mastered.
Men must be lead in battle.
The calm heart does not beat like a drum.
No task is humble if it is done well.
There is great honour in service to the Emperor.
ancillaries.onscreen_name: Clan Specialism Retainer: Imperial Training Network

ancillaries.colour_text: Tradition and honour are everything.
ancillaries.onscreen_name: Clan Specialism Retainer: Shogunate Training Network

ancillaries.colour_text: Training is never wasted in life.
ancillaries.onscreen_name: Clan Specialism Retainer: Yumi Training Network

ancillaries.colour_text: Without a good seat, a horseman is useless.
ancillaries.onscreen_name: Clan Specialism Retainer: Cavalry Training Network

ancillaries.colour_text: "It's not a pointed stick! It's a spear!"
ancillaries.onscreen_name: Clan Specialism Retainer: Yari Training Network

ancillaries.colour_text: The sword is the spirit of the samurai.
ancillaries.onscreen_name: Clan Specialism Retainer: Sword Training Network

ancillaries.colour_text: Everything can be perfected.
The noble steed demands a noble master.
A noble sign brings terror to enemies' hearts.
When men lift their eyes to heaven, their hearts follow.
The God of Battles should show a hard face to the world.
What use a general's brains if they are splashed to the winds?
Wisdom should be protected; protection is wisdom.
ancillaries.onscreen_name: Legendary Item: Legendary Kabuto of The Shogun

ancillaries.colour_text: Sometimes age adds to the worthiness of a thing.
The wise man seeks out the very best of everything.
Some swords will seek out worthy hands.
Ore no hobaakurafuto unagi ippai aru!
A man is weighed and found wanting; another goes free. This is law.
Words on paper do not kill, but change lives.
"That is a courageous decision, my lord."
Authority is the spirit of government.
"More tea? Or better tea?"
Who benefits most? The drinker, or the cup that fulfils its purpose?
The porcelain cup and the tea master are one.
"Grrrr!"
Honourable men bring honour to their master.
"As you wish it, my lord!"
A thousand days of archery practice is a good start.
The sincere shot flies true, and strikes the mark.
Only an arrow's length separates archer and target.
The target waits impatiently for the arrow.
The word must be spoken for the deed to begin.
Government is the only duty of the governor.
A monk remains a man, with a man's honour.
A man puts aside much to become a monk, but never honour.
Pale as the uncanny dead, and the distant Moon in winter.
In a moment of stillness: poetry.
The poem waits for the right pen.
Against some daggers, armour is no defence.
"Where we're going, we won't need eyes to see."
Listen to the music, not the player of the music.
Woman's wisdom should always be heeded.
Delicacy in all things, even a cup of tea.
Not everyone walks the path in honesty.
"Courage! Set aside a family to find true kin."
“I am trying not to use my sword!”
On a mountain, a man sees further.
From calm, all things grow.
The world will provide.
Quench the raging fires within.
Music speaks to the soul.
Life's beauty is transitory, and always reborn.
A hungry student listens only to his belly.
"See how the tree becomes the image of enlightenment."
Unlike men, cats are true to their own nature.
Enlightenment is a song, drifting on the evening breeze.
Meaning is not measured in gold.
There is wonder in all things of this world.
All Japan is hallowed.
Understanding is at the centre of all.
Words mean what words mean.
The image is an echo of a truth.
Not all mysteries need be understood.
"Peaceful" does not mean "defenceless".
"Would you deny a holy man his only support?"
The wise man does not set aside all defence.
Retiring from the world is not ignoring the world.
Poverty is sometimes the best concealment.
The heart beats faster in the presence of beauty.
Skilled lips bring many pleasures.
Hiding a treacherous smile is sensible, not coy.
Eerily beautiful, and as entrancing as moonlight in a lover’s eyes.
Some things do cut like a woman's tongue.
"He is no wajin, but his cured meats are indeed excellent!"
Grrrr!
The beat of the drum echoes the heart.
The commoner with courage should be kept close; he may show his worth again.
A good horse will carry a general into battle and think the sword no more fearsome than a butterfly.
A samurai who saves his general, should be rewarded with the chance to repeat his gallantry.
Plain gaijin steel has honesty, and honesty is usually fashionable.
A breastplate of the finest Spanish steel, worked by good Christians, can turn aside any blade or bullet.
No army that marches beneath the banner of Christ, blessed by the Holy Father, can ever suffer defeat!
The flag says: here stands a great warlord, the heir to great warlords! Strong as the storm! Fear his might!
Meditation helps.
Some cards make their owners lucky.
Not a game. War. Without blood.
"I find it a very persuasive argument."
The holiest of water may convert many a heathen.
"Behold, thou art fair, my love…"
Such a small thing, to hold so much Christian virtue.
A man of God should not be an unarmed fool.
"Is it warm in here?"
"Do try the fish."
Every good player knows that victory is the precise application of strategy.
Anything from the far side of the world, even the strange "Low Countries", grants power.
Worn in battle by many great warriors, and sanctified by time, this is armour truly fit for a hero.
Sword training is hardly ever wasted.
Serious sword training is rarely wasted.
Chastisement comes in many forms.
A warrior's chest may be pierced by a thousand arrows but, as long as his heart is true, what does it matter?
The armour of a great hero, passed down the generations, is an honour to wear.
Don't lose your head!
To meet the sword's edge is the only true test of courage.
Armour is prudent in times of strife.
The terrible visage of this battle mask is enough to strike fear into the heart of any foe.
To cut to the heart of the matter in one stroke, that is the great thing.
A single thrust, and life is gone.
Life leaves easily when the shinobigatana calls.
A sword acquires fame only in the hands of a worthy man.
A mirror reveals much to one who would search deep within with an unflinching gaze.
Only the very greatest would contemplate drawing the sword of a goddess. Only a fool would stand against it.
Only the foolish would contemplate drawing the sword of the Moon. Only the greatest would stand against it.
A blade from distant Spain is exotic and deadly, and a mark of the gaijin King's favour.
Nothing is what it seems.
"…And like that, he's gone!"
"He went that way!"
"I'm too drunk to be an assassin!"
"I am a man of God!"
"Oooh, you have got rough hands!"
"Let them look in all the wrong places!"
"Look, I'm not a squid, right?"
Every ninja has his tricks.
One cut, one death.
The tiger climbs, and rends, as he will.
"My lord's lands and affairs need careful tending. There is honour in serving faithfully."
Like a kyosha, we can only move forwards in life.
"All men gamble, with their lives, their loves and their loyalties. The trick is to profit by it."
"Gissa job! I could do that. No, really, I could do that. Go on, gissa job!"
"They will do as I say, my lord. And we will profit by it."
A man who has turned against his own kind makes the best hunter when the time comes.
"My lord need only say the word, and the fish will be well fed…"
A man can die in many ways, but choking on a fish bone is truly unfortunate.
A brave man never thinks of the dangers when he eats fugu. His guard is down.
A townsman knows how to find back alleys and secret ways, missing nothing as he walks the streets.
"Pass the rice, fatty, before you eat it all!"
"I listen. I learn. I look after the master."
"This is a sword! Your blade - ha! - I would not scrape out a peasants' dungheap with it!"
Some friendships are not lightly cast aside.
A man who shares sake, and does not speak of what was spoken, should be held close.
Even the mightiest man had to learn how to use his might from someone.
Entertaining distractions are always welcome, perhaps more so when they disguise the assassin's blade.
The arts of flattery must be practiced, then may a client become comfortable.
"Just a little something I picked up on holiday…"
To serve with supreme elegance is to put a man at his ease, and thereby breach his defences.
A general must have his orders obeyed, otherwise bravery will be wasted.
"I have little skill with wounds in the back. I cannot treat cowardice!"
At the soul of a drumbeat is the sound of man's heart.
"I never presume, my lord, but I do keep correct tally."
"Trade, my lord, is beneath your dignity, but wealth is never dishonourable."
"The people, even the humblest of peasants, should not be denied because they are humble!"
Impressionable youth can have its uses.
Much can be read of a man's heart, loyalties and destiny if one only has the skill to interpret the signs correctly.
Plinky-plunky-plinky-plunky-plunk.
"I will sing in praise of total war!"
Even the mightiest lord deserves some small comforts: the perfect meal being one of them.
"Confucius has much to say on everything, my lord."
"That is not how we do it in China, my lord."
The palsy and the pox will kill a man as surely as any blade.
Only a fool looks after his sword yet neglects his horse.
An extra pair of eyes will spot the hidden enemy.
"White is black if the Church so orders it!"
"Of course, my lord. Another song about blossoms. Right away."
"Twang!"
There are always secrets, but there need be no mysteries for the truly enlightened.
Money matters.
Cunning and mastery wrought in stone.
Armour must be cunningly made, or it is a dead weight.
From the hands of the master, a bow always shoots true.
Castle walls are more than stones piled one on another. There is an art to it.
Wrought in iron, death comes from the flames.
The sword leaps from the scabbard, the master only guides it.
"I do not need to fight to know that your school is clearly inferior."
Bushido is a start to mastery.
Moderation in war is imbecility.
"Your bowstring, my lord. It is disharmonious."
"There is no art in slashing a man to pieces!"
In small things lies great perfection.
"One day, I will make a perfect blade. One day…"
The simple weapon is always the hardest to master.
The horse gallops; the arrow flies; the master has done... nothing.
There is no puppeteer.
To capture a thought, a moment, on paper: that is power.
There are strategies to everything, from love to conquest.
"Hmmm. Let me consider…"
In one gesture, a world of emotion…
"Drink. Be at peace."
"Shhhh!"
There are eyes and ears everywhere, but only one mind.
"Flagellation! That's what! Whip some faith into the little bleeders!"
"I am the Spirit of Dark and Lonely Water, ready to trap the unwary, the show-off, the fool…"
"You mind my leaves!"
"Rice cakes? Rice cakes? Rice! Cakes! That's all you ever want!"
Mad as he may be, this crow knows he is a great swordsman.
There is much cunning in laying out a fortress, and in encouraging an attacker ever on to his doom.
A man's best armour is courage, but good iron, cunningly worked, is an excellent addition.
The bow that is made with care will not fail, and will always shoot true.
To take a stone, and reshape it, and keep the spirits of the place at peace, is to be a master of your craft.
Even with a gun, there is honour in making it well, and in adding refinement to the tools of war.
To draw a sword and kill a man before he has blinked - that is skill.
Sometimes, the sword is a distraction to the warrior.
The way of sword is far more than killing an enemy. Killing is not even a beginning to mastery.
In the right hands, everything is a weapon to fear.
The art of the bow should never be neglected, for it lies at the heart of what it once was to be samurai.
To hold a weapon is not difficult. To use it requires skill. To master it requires everything.
Even a tiny thing can be perfect when it comes from the hands of a master.
All swords are dangerous: a master ensures that only the enemy needs worry about that danger.
A spear looks simple, but to use it elegantly and with precision takes practice and dedication.
It is not enough to be a great horseman, or a great archer. The yabusame transcends both in search of the perfect shot.
For the puppet to touch the audience's souls, the puppeteer must vanish.
The perfect brush stroke is worth a lifetime's skill.
The first step towards a perfect tea ceremony is a nice tea cup.
Go teaches the art of strategy, and this brilliant man is the embodiment of victory through cunning.
"Do not think of a strategy. Be a strategy."
Cherry blossom falls,/poetry on the Spring breeze:/Swords cease their clashing.
The real tragedy is that all performances must one day end in silence.
Fire. Water. Tea. A bowl. A sip. One perfect moment.
I am not here. I have never been here.
Even a bit of rough has uses, and hidden talents.
"When you are without sin, come back with your stones!"
"And what, my love, is wrong with thinking of yourself?"
"Cleverness, a witty tongue and a modicum of lust in one rather attractive kimono."
"No, I do not keep her for her wits!"
"Ooh! That's fancy, innit?"
"Shhhh! Walls have ears."
"My love, you can do so much better…"
A lover of surpassing skill, for all her faults.
Music quiets the troubled heart.
"His Most Catholic Majesty has no idea that I even exist, my lord."
"I'll wager those hands have never strangled a porpentine in a tropical storm, arrrr!"
The man who reads the moods of the sea, and profits by his skill, has value above pearls to a naval commander.
To read the waves, clouds and breeze is to be valuable.
"I will give these sons of Nihon a taste of their own medicine."
A good eye for wind and wave can be profitable.
"Honour? This is business!"
"Get off me, you miserable rice-nibbling bugger!"
In the breeding of fish, why should not perfection be attainable?
"Bow down before Judge Fish!"
For the huntsman, what else matters other than the chase?
For the huntsman, what else matters other than the chase?
"Ooo-ooo-Eeeek!"
"No, he is a Christian."
"So you see: there are no chop-sticks. There never were."
There are many paths to Buddha.
Fear is the key.
Some men serve by watching from the shadows.
"Your sins are grievous, my son, but forgiveness of its children is the soul of the Church."
Rome is a long, long way away.
A sharp sword always helps the Word of God.
"The Father needs protection."
"More tea, vicar?"
"The living God and his Son will not be denied, even in this heathen land of devilry!"
Accurate records are the bedrock of the Church's power.
One way, two heavens, many dead.
A wise samurai does not always need to draw his sword, or see others fight, to know the outcome.
"How'd you like to kill thirty bandits?"
"If you can’t run in a war then it’s already over."
"I'm Hayashida Heihachi, a fencer of the Wood Cut School."
"No sir, my decision has been made. I'll follow you, sir."
"If it had been a real sword, you would be dead."
"I can't kill a lot with one sword!"
When swords are drawn, talk gives way to death.
"...lost in the swirling maze of past and future ages..."
"...somewhere along the infinite corridors of time..."
For the huntsman, what else matters other than the chase?
A good horse will carry a general into battle and think the sword no more fearsome than a butterfly.
An officer should know his enemy.
The world, brought closer.
"The squid! The squid! That's the best bit!"
ancillaries.onscreen_name: Jules Verne's "20,000 Leagues Under the Sea"

ancillaries.colour_text: There is more to a farmers' world than rice.
Make every shot count.
"Ah, the misfortune to be British..."
"Learn what your enemy thinks, and you learn his weaknesses."
War is the school of warriors.
"Sordid, lurid stuff, and funny. But it tells us a truth about the gaijin."
"Paine-san: a gaijin with dangerous, alien... ideas…"
"I begin to understand how little I understand these Americans…"
People in low places also have their uses.
"Now there is time, there is no time left to admire the waves."
Time is never wasted, only misspent.
"Once, I measured my life by the fall of blossoms…"
"My patients, sir, survive or I will know the reason why!"
The palsy and the pox will kill a man as surely as any blade.
"Be still, damn you! The leg is coming off!"
"I have little skill with wounds in the back. I cannot treat cowardice!"
"This are serious retainer."
Japan is a land of wonders.
"We inform sir, and by doing so, form opinions in the capitals of the world."
"My readers, sir, will marvel over their breakfasts as they learn of your valorous exploits!"
"I'm from 'The Thunderer', don't you know!"
"Poouffe!"
"Certainly, sir…"
"I say! How quaint! Is that a sword?"
"Swords? Swords are for English girls!"
Some cards make their owners lucky.
Not a game. War. Without blood.
"Remember who pays the rent."
The arts of flattery must be practiced, then may a client become comfortable.
Entertaining distractions are always welcome, perhaps more so when they disguise the assassin's blade.
To serve with supreme elegance is to put a man at his ease, and thereby breach his defences.
"Just a little something I picked up on holiday…"
Music soothes the warlike spirit.
"It is the gun by which Her Majesty would wish to be shot!"
It is a powerful thing to hold six lives in one hand.
There is always a last defence.
"The bullet is substantial; the needle is within the workings."
"But there are no elephants in Japan..."
"Bang!"
"This, sir, will stop a man, or make a tiger rethink his menu!"
"A bit of a kick, but nothing a good man cannot handle."
There is comfort in the traditional.
"It is good enough for the German Imperial army, and so good enough for anyone!"
"Simple, sturdy, and soldier-proof. Deadly, in the right hands, too."
"Do not accept inferior German products, monsieur!"
"Proven in combat, by the Confederate States, among others."
"Mr Smith and Mrs Wesson and their six lead offspring guarantee your life."
"A good reliable weapon, as you'd expect from Her Majesty's Government."
"It works well, sir, in persuadin' 'ornery folk to leave you and yours alone!"
The best in death dealing, furnished by American ingenuity.
"I rarely miss with this!"
"I find they keep out the cold."
Absinthe makes the heart grow fonder.
Up, up and away!
A most magnificent way to travel, other than the oil stains.
"They look close enough now."
"Look at the birdy!"
Expensive. Foreign. Interesting bubbles...
"You won't feel a thing."
Foreign contrivances to enjoyment have their uses.
"Is it warm in here?"

"Gentlemen should exercise caution and wear stout-sided boots when using the Fintry-Kyle Escape Apparatus. Ladies, children, servants and those of a nervous disposition should be strongly encouraged to seek other means of hurried egress."
A battlefleet obeys orders. Fishermen drift.
Orders are orders.
A cow in a bottle! What will these foreigners think of next?
A good firm swing is always an answer.
A game of kings, played by any man.
"I got my head stuck, and I still don't know what the cricket bat was for…"
Every good player knows that victory is the precise application of strategy.
"I find a nine iron persuasive."
A game of princes, played by lesser men.
To tame the sun might be considered arrogance.
All the world, awaiting a conqueror!
Gentlemen appreciate warm hands.
"Click-click-clickety-whirr-click."
"You won't feel a thing."
"Say 'Ahhhh!'"
No matter how small, the world has many surprises.
"It is the very latest fashion in the palaces of Europe."
Tiddly-pom-pom-pom.
Plinky-plinky-plonk.
"Imagine! The bottom of the sea!"
To measure the stars is to diminish their grandeur.
Even heaven's secrets are not safe.
Elegance sometimes gives way to convenience.
"One day, I will carry one of these in my pocket!"
Those who chase the dragon often become the prey.
"Do try the fish."
A little goes a long way.
Gaijin fear a man with the refined taste to wear one of these.
A samurai should always be well groomed.
A practical weapon for a practical man.
"These Scotsmen must be a fierce, warrior folk!"
Speed, excitement and, on occasion, a broken limb!
There is cunning in counting accurately.
"Filthy stuff, but I enjoy it. Atishoo!"
"And the bubbles are fun too!"
Sword training is hardly ever wasted.
Taxes and artillery bombardments rely on accurate land measurements.
"Mrs Peel, we're needed!"
"A woman! The British are truly an odd people!"
Many problems can be solved with cold steel.
The Black Bear is come!
The Red Bear is come!
The White Bear is come!
Worn in battle by many great warriors, and sanctified by time, this is armour truly fit for a hero.
"I will sing in praise of total war!"
A warrior's chest may be pierced by a thousand arrows but, as long as his heart is true, what does it matter?
The flag says: here stands a great warlord, the heir to great warlords! Strong as the storm! Fear his might!
There are strategies for everything, from love to conquest.
"Hmmmm. Let me consider..."
Don't lose your head!
To meet the sword's edge is the only true test of courage.
Armour is prudent in times of strife.
"Twang!"
The terrible visage of this battle mask is enough to strike fear into the heart of any foe.
"Shhhh!"
A single thrust, and life is gone.
There are eyes and ears everywhere, but only one mind.
The armour of a great hero, passed down the generations, is an honour to wear.
A sword acquires fame only in the hands of a worthy man.
"Drink. Be at peace."
"Hi-ho, Silver!"
All swords are dangerous: a master ensures that only the enemy needs worry about that danger.
Go teaches the art of strategy, and this brilliant man is the embodiment of victory through cunning.
"Do not think of a strategy. Be a strategy."
To draw a sword and kill a man before he has blinked - that is skill.
Sometimes, the sword is a distraction to the warrior.
The way of sword is far more than killing an enemy. Killing is not even a beginning to mastery.
The art of the bow should never be neglected, for it lies at the heart of what it once was to be samurai.
"I am not here. I have never been here."
A spear looks simple, but to use it elegantly and with precision takes practice and dedication.
Fire. Water. Tea. A bowl. A sip. One perfect moment.
"I will fight damn Yankees wherever they may be found, sir!"
"My love, you can do so much better..."
"Ooh! That's fancy, innit?"
"Shhhh! Walls have ears."
Hair like sunlight, eyes like the unclouded sky…
Discipline comes in many forms.
"Cleverness, a witty tongue and a modicum of lust in one rather attractive kimono."
"No, I do not keep her for her wits!"
A lover of surpassing skill, for all her faults.
Even a bit of rough has uses, and hidden talents.
"Rich country: strong army."
"Real? Of course it's real!"
The beat of the drum echoes the heart.
Music quiets the troubled heart.
"A Frenchman, sir, builds a ship with a soul. Any Anglo-Saxon idiot can make an ironclad."
"There are ironclad arguments as to why the Royal Navy rules the waves."
Nothing is what it seems.
A brave man never thinks of the dangers when he eats fugu. His guard is down.
A man can die in many ways, but choking on a fish bone is truly unfortunate.
The tiger climbs, and rends, as he will.
"Look, I'm not a squid, right?"
"I'm from Swansea, look you!"
"Oooh, you have got rough hands!"
"Let them look in all the wrong places!"
"I am a man of god!"
"I'm too drunk to be an assassin!"
"He went that way!"
"...And like that, he's gone!"
"All men gamble, with their lives, their loves and their loyalties. The trick is to profit by it."
Every ninja has his tricks.
One cut, one death.
"We invented trains. Why bother with any inferior imitations?"
"American ingenuity, sir, has conquered continents to build the world's greatest railroads!"
One day, Japan will have its Crewe!
Words sent across the land bring action in their wake.
"They took my horse and made him surrender."
"We will expel all the barbarians…by the sword if necessary!"
"This is a sword! Your blade - ha! - I would not scrape out a peasants' dungheap with it!"
"Pass the rice, fatty, before you eat it all!"
"I listen. I learn. I look after the master."
Plinky-plunky-plinky-plunky-plunk.
An extra pair of eyes will spot the hidden enemy.
"I would not feed this muck to Englishmen!"
Even the mightiest lord deserves some small comforts: the perfect meal being one of them.
"The croissant? French? Bah. In name only."
"At once, mein herr!"
Only a fool looks after his sword yet neglects his horse.
Like a kyosha, we can only move forwards in life.
Money matters.
A man who has turned against his own kind makes the best hunter when the time comes.
"My lord need only say the word, and the fish will be well fed…"
"Soon a reaction will take place, and the daimyos of the north have offered me to be its soul."
"I do not build BLOODY ENGLISH lighthouses!"
"We are the force of the White Tiger!"
Only decent boots do more than duty and glory in making men march.
Every Frenchman has a cavalryman's heart.
The French: no one stands in battle like a Frenchman.
"We are the force of the Black Turtle!"
"May I present…this country's first steam locomotive…the Iron Duke, no less!"
Every Frenchman understands "la gloire".
"The Japanese are disposed towards us as well as to other foreigners; whatever will be the material development of English power in this country, they run to us alone for reforms."
"Respect and Harmony."
"French rubbish. Don't buy it."
"British rubbish. Don't buy it."
"We are the force of the Blue Dragon!"
"Her Majesty's Envoy Extraordinary, Minister Plenipotentiary and Consul-General in Japan, at your service."
"We are the force of the Red Sparrow!"
With the English on their doorstep, French admirals have every incentive to be good.
"I represent only the interests of the great United States of America, sir!"
A coastal fort is an unsinkable ship.
"I challenge you. And now you will fail!"
Sumo is the root of every martial art.
Who ate all the noodles?
"British stodge, German stodge, or French panache: those are your choices!"
"German know-how. German steel. German artillery. The best, naturally."
"British guns, sir, and some British guts, have given us an Empire!"
"I guarantee my wares will bring down a charging heathen savage, sir, or your money back."
There is alchemy in London, to transform paper into gold.
"A Frenchman, sir, mixes business with passion!"
"One day, Japan will be modern."
"Trade, my lord, is beneath your dignity, but wealth is never dishonourable."
"Taxes, my lord, pay for brave warriors and carry swords and armour, and food and - and all other necessaries!"
"Americans, sir, respect achievement. And money."
A man should always dress smartly.
Clothes maketh the man.
"It was a gift."
There should be decorum in all things.
"A fool goes out in a blizzard."
"Do I look fat in this?"
"I challenge you. And now you will fail!"
Sumo is the root of every martial art.
Who ate all the noodles?
